body: @crsleeth just in you terminal, outside of docker, can you post what you get with `nvidia-smi` please?

Hi @MMathisLab, I currently face the exact same problem. I use the same operating system and deeplabcut docker version as **crsleeth** (latest version) but with two Nvidia RTX 3090 SLI.

Are there any news regarding this issue?

Your help is very much appreciated.

![nvidia_smi](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/91895402/162422602-1074c9a4-15db-4482-a865-e11d6b2f19ee.png)

I am facing exactly the same issue.

Running the following code:

import tensorflow as tf
tf.config.list_physical_devices("GPU")

Returns the the following error: 

2022-07-26 22:57:55.527622: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:53] Successfully opened dynamic library libcudart.so.11.0
2022-07-26 22:57:56.451989: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:64] Could not load dynamic library 'libcuda.so.1'; dlerror: libcuda.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory; LD_LIBRARY_PATH: /usr/local/nvidia/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib64
2022-07-26 22:57:56.452008: W tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_driver.cc:326] failed call to cuInit: UNKNOWN ERROR (303)
2022-07-26 22:57:56.452027: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:163] no NVIDIA GPU device is present: /dev/nvidia0 does not exist

I can confirm [hejiaonju](https://github.com/hejiaonju)’s issue. The docker image for deeplabcut can’t utilize the GPU because it looks in the wrong place for the libcuda library and because it doesn’t see the present video hardware.

I've had the same issue with the docker container (installed with the deeplabcut-docker helper). 

Not gonna lie, I tried to hack this by running the container with user privileges to create /
usr/local/nvidia/lib64 
/usr/local/nvidia/lib

and making a simlink to the libcuda.so.1 located in 
/usr/local/cuda-11.4/compat/libcuda.so.1

It didnt work....


`2022-08-30 00:11:56.982345: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:64] Could not load dynamic library 'libcuda.so.1'; dlerror: libcuda.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory; LD_LIBRARY_PATH: /usr/local/nvidia/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib64
2022-08-30 00:11:56.982374: W tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_driver.cc:326] failed call to cuInit: UNKNOWN ERROR (303)
2022-08-30 00:11:56.982396: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:163] no NVIDIA GPU device is present: /dev/nvidia0 does not exist
`

i kept poking around with this.

I had some luck set a new LD_LIBRARY_PATH to include the location of libcuda.so.1 in the container. However, my GPU still wasnt found, as it did have access to /dev/nvidia0

I had luck mounting /dev as a volume. so all in all, I called the container with:

`(DLC) dprotter@dprotter-System-Product-Name:~$ export TEMP_VAR=/usr/local/nvidia/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib64:/usr/local/cuda-11.4/compat
(DLC) dprotter@dprotter-System-Product-Name:~$ deeplabcut-docker bash -e LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$TEMP_VAR -v /dev/:/dev/
`

and now get a classic driver mismatch error:
`>>> import tensorflow as tf
2022-08-30 19:58:55.284704: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:53] Successfully opened dynamic library libcudart.so.11.0
tf.>>> tf.config.list_physical_devices('GPU')
2022-08-30 19:59:04.723428: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:53] Successfully opened dynamic library libcuda.so.1
2022-08-30 19:59:04.748734: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_driver.cc:328] failed call to cuInit: CUDA_ERROR_NO_DEVICE: no CUDA-capable device is detected
2022-08-30 19:59:04.748792: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:169] retrieving CUDA diagnostic information for host: 54f64c9834b9
2022-08-30 19:59:04.748824: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:176] hostname: 54f64c9834b9
2022-08-30 19:59:04.749152: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:200] libcuda reported version is: 470.57.2
2022-08-30 19:59:04.749199: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:204] kernel reported version is: 470.141.3
2022-08-30 19:59:04.749214: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:313] kernel version 470.141.3 does not match DSO version 470.57.2 -- cannot find working devices in this configuration
[]
`

tensorflow correctly finds the GPU if I'm outside of the container

Hi everyone, I want to follow this discussion because we have a very similar problem.
We pip installed deeplabcut-docker helper package and get the helper package to pull the docker image for us.
After we built the container `deeplabcut-docker bash` , we realised that the GPU was not detected.
Therefore, we first explored what  LD_LIBRARY_PATH pointed to and set a new path for LD_LIBRARY_PATH. Then we included an extra command when we started the container  `deeplabcut-docker bash --gpus all`, somehow we could detected the GPU again. We did try to build the gui container with this extra command, however we saw this error 

> "Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/usr/lib/python3.8/runpy.py", line 185, in _run_module_as_main
>     mod_name, mod_spec, code = _get_module_details(mod_name, _Error)
>   File "/usr/lib/python3.8/runpy.py", line 144, in _get_module_details
>     return _get_module_details(pkg_main_name, error)
>   File "/usr/lib/python3.8/runpy.py", line 111, in _get_module_details
>     __import__(pkg_name)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/__init__.py", line 27, in <module>
>     from deeplabcut import generate_training_dataset
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/__init__.py", line 12, in <module>
>     from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.trainingsetmanipulation import *
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 23, in <module>
>     from deeplabcut.pose_estimation_tensorflow import training
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/__init__.py", line 12, in <module>
>     from deeplabcut.pose_estimation_tensorflow.datasets import *
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/datasets/__init__.py", line 11, in <module>
>     from .pose_deterministic import DeterministicPoseDataset
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/datasets/pose_deterministic.py", line 19, in <module>
>     from deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos import imread, imresize
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/utils/__init__.py", line 6, in <module>
>     from deeplabcut.utils.make_labeled_video import *
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/utils/make_labeled_video.py", line 26, in <module>
>     import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 2500, in <module>
>     switch_backend(rcParams["backend"])
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 285, in switch_backend
>     raise ImportError(
> ImportError: Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running
> [2022-09-07T16:06:12+0200]: Failed to launch the DLC GUI. Used args: "-e DISPLAY=unix -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v :/home/developer/.Xauthority -v /home/neuropc:/app -w /app --gpus all"

So in conclusion, we somehow managed to work around this issue by setting a new path for LD_LIBRARY_PATH and adding extra command " deeplabcut-docker bash --gpus all". However, there are extra issues with the gui mode.

can you report the output of: 
```
cat /etc/gdm3/custom.conf | grep WaylandEnable
echo $XDG_SESSION_TYPE
echo $DISPLAY
```
please now try running `pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall 'deeplabcut[gui]'==2.3rc1` in your env and/or docker. I will close, but please do post back!

Hi,

I'm having this problem too - I tried running `pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall 'deeplabcut[gui]'==2.3rc1` then starting again using `deeplabcut-docker gui` and running. I still see zero use of the graphics card when running `nvidia-smi`. 

Do I need to set a new LD_LIBRARY_PATH before I do this? If so, how do I set it? Just do it in the bash one and it will translate over?

Hi,

We are having the same issue as Steve. We tried pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall 'deeplabcut[gui]'==2.3rc1 and the GPU is still not being engaged (per nvidia-smi)
On our radar to fix cc @stes , thanks @samcentanni -- should be a new container out by Jan.
